PC Japanese (JP): 絵羽は茂みに向かって駆け出す。……そしてすぐに譲治の亡骸を見つけ、絶叫し、そして号泣した。
Russian (RU): Ева бросилась к кустам. ......Она почти сразу же нашла труп Джорджа, закричала и зарыдала.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eva correu na direção dos arbustos. ......Ela encontrou o corpo de George quase que na mesma hora, gritou e foi às lágrimas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 繪羽朝那片灌木叢跑了過去。……接著，她馬上發現了讓治的屍骸，尖聲大叫，然後嚎啕大哭。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 绘羽朝那片灌木丛跑了过去。……接着，她马上发现了让治的尸骸，尖声大叫，然后嚎啕大哭。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Eva si precipitò verso i cespugli. ... Trovò il corpo di George quasi immediatamente, gridò e cadde a terra singhiozzando.

Steam (ST): ...Rudolf's bloody corpse was exposed to the rain that ran down off the eaves.
Umineko Project (UP): ......Rudolf's bloody corpse was exposed to the rain that ran down off the eaves.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……留弗夫の無残な亡骸が、ひさしからぼたぼたと垂れる水滴に晒される。
Russian (RU): ......Окровавленный труп Рудольфа был выставлен под дождь, стекающий с карниза.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......O cadáver de Rudolf ficou exposto à chuva que escorria do beiral.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……留弗夫淒慘的屍骸，暴露在了從屋檐啪嗒啪嗒地往下滴的水滴之下。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……留弗夫凄惨的尸骸，暴露在了从屋檐啪嗒啪嗒地往下滴的水滴之下。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Il corpo insanguinato di Rudolf era esposto alla pioggia che scendeva giù dal cornicione.

Steam (ST): His eyes were still wide open. A fist-sized, flesh-covered hole was open in the back of his head, ...and his insides were exposed to the open air.
Umineko Project (UP): His eyes were still wide open. A ragged, fist‐sized hole had been torn open in the back of his head, ......exposing its contents to the open air.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): His eyes were still wide open. A fist-sized, flesh-covered hole was open in the back of his head, ......and his insides were exposed to the open air.
PC Japanese (JP): 目は見開いたまま。後頭部には握り拳ほどの大きさに、ぐずぐずの挽き肉状の穴が開き、……その中身を外気に晒していた。
Russian (RU): Его глаза до сих пор были широко раскрыты. В затылке открылась окровавленная дыра размером с кулак...... и внутренности вышли на открытый воздух.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Seus olhos ainda estavam abertos. Um buraco irregular, do tamanho de um punho, estava aberto na parte traseira de sua cabeça, ......expondo seu conteúdo à céu aberto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 睜著眼。後腦開了個拳頭般大小的，稀爛稀爛的碎肉狀的洞，……把他腦袋裡的東西暴露在了外面的空氣中。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 睁着眼。后脑开了个拳头般大小的，稀烂稀烂的碎肉状的洞，……把他脑袋里的东西暴露在了外面的空气中。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): I suoi occhi erano ancora spalancati. Un buco grande come un pugno, coperto di carne, era aperto sul retro della sua testa... e il suo interno era esposto all'aria aperta.

Steam (ST): Inside was a mixed jelly of flesh, brains, and spinal fluid.
Umineko Project (UP): Inside was minced flesh and bright red jelly.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Inside was a mixed jelly of flesh, brains, and spinal fluid.
PC Japanese (JP): その中身は、ぐずぐずの挽き肉と、脳みそと脳漿の、真っ赤なぐちゃぐちゃゼリー。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): その中身は、ぐずぐずの挽き肉と、真っ赤なぐちゃぐちゃゼリー。
Russian (RU): Внутри было желе из плоти, мозга и спинномозговой жидкости.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Dentro, carne moída escorrendo e uma geleia vermelha pegajosa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 它們是，稀爛稀爛的碎肉，跟腦水與腦漿組成的鮮紅的粘粘糊糊的果凍。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 它们是，稀烂稀烂的碎肉，跟脑水与脑浆组成的鲜红的粘粘糊糊的果冻。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Dentro c'era una gelatina mista di carne, cervella e liquido cerebro spinale.

Steam (ST): That goop, which looked like someone had mixed it up with a spoon, dripped from his eyes, nose, ears, mouth, and the hole in his head...
Umineko Project (UP): That goop, which looked like someone had mixed it up with a spoon, dripped from his eyes, nose, ears, mouth, and the hole in his head......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That goop, which looked like someone had mixed it up with a spoon, dripped from his eyes, nose, ears, mouth, and the hole in his head......
PC Japanese (JP): それをスプーンでぐるぐるに混ぜて振ったような汁が、目と鼻と耳と口と頭の穴から、どろりどろりと零れ出していた……。
Russian (RU): Эта масса, которая выглядела так, будто её размешали ложкой, вытекла из его глаз, носа, ушей, рта и дыры в голове......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aquele espécie de suco, que parecia ter sido misturado com uma colher, escorrendo por seus olhos, nariz, ouvido, boca e toda a sua cabeça......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 恰似用湯匙把它們一圈圈拌勻了的汁水，從眼、鼻、耳、口與腦袋上的那個洞中，粘粘地流了出來……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 恰似用汤匙把它们一圈圈拌匀了的汁水，从眼、鼻、耳、口与脑袋上的那个洞中，粘粘地流了出来……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quella gelatina, che sembrava come se qualcuno l'avesse mescolata con un cucchiaio, gocciolava dai suoi occhi, naso, orecchie, bocca e dal buco nella sua testa...

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Steam (ST): "...Dad, ...Dad... ...Aaaaaaaaahhh...!!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「………お父さん……、お父さん………。……ううぅうううぅッ…！！！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Papà... Papà... aaaaaaaaahhh...!!!"

Steam (ST): Ange clutched at her head, sobbing and moaning.
Umineko Project (UP): Ange clutched at her head, sobbing and moaning.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 縁寿は頭を抱えて、泣きながら呻く。
Russian (RU): Энджи в рыданиях и стонах схватилась за голову.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ange agarrou sua cabeça, soluçando e gemendo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 緣壽抱住頭，邊哭邊呻吟。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 缘寿抱住头，边哭边呻吟。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ange strinse la sua testa, singhiozzando e lamentandosi.

Steam (ST): Her father had dirtied his hands with murder over money, and on top of that, he had faced such a cruel end, and Ange had been forced to see his corpse. It was hard to imagine a more painful experience for a daughter to go through.
Umineko Project (UP): Her father had dirtied his hands with murder over money, and on top of that, he had faced such a cruel end, and Ange had been forced to see his corpse. It was hard to imagine a more painful experience for a daughter to go through.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Her father had dirtied his hands with murder over money, and on top of that, he had faced such a cruel end, and Ange had been forced to see his corpse. It was hard to imagine a more painful experience for a daughter to go through.
PC Japanese (JP): 自分の父親がカネ目当てに殺人に手を染め、さらにその上、無残な最期を遂げて、その亡骸まで見せ付けるなんて。娘である彼女にとって、これほど耐え難い物語はあるまい。
Russian (RU): Её отец замарал руки убийством ради денег, да ещё и встретил такой жестокий конец, и Энджи вынудили смотреть на его труп. Было трудно представить себе более мучительный опыт для дочери.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Seu pai havia sujado as mãos ao matar por dinheiro, posteriormente se deparando com um cruel destino enquanto Ange era forçada a ver seu cadáver. Difícil imaginar uma experiência mais dolorosa a qual uma filha poderia passar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 自己的父親為了錢而染指殺人，不僅如此，他還落得了個慘死的下場，連這屍骸都被亮在了自己的眼前。對身為女兒的她來說，再也沒有比這更叫她難以忍受的故事了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 自己的父亲为了钱而染指杀人，不仅如此，他还落得了个惨死的下场，连这尸骸都被亮在了自己的眼前。对身为女儿的她来说，再也没有比这更叫她难以忍受的故事了。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Suo Padre si era sporcato le mani in un omicidio per denaro, e oltretutto aveva incontrato una fine così tragica e Ange era stata costretta a vedere il suo cadavere. Era difficile immaginare un'esperienza più dolorosa da attraversare, per una figlia.

Steam (ST): ...I'm totally fed up with this. It's completely meaningless.
Umineko Project (UP): ......I'm totally fed up with this. It's completely meaningless.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Não aguento mais isso. Não faz o menor sentido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……我已經受夠了。沒有任何意義。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……我已经受够了。没有任何意义。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): ... Ormai ne ho abbastanza. Non ha assolutamente senso.

Steam (ST): "{f:5:Bernkastel}-san...! I know you're here somewhere! Please, make this game stop...!! There's no point to it!"
Umineko Project (UP): "{f:5:Bernkastel}‐san...! I know you're here somewhere! Please, make this game stop...!! There's no point to it!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Bernkastel-san...! I know you're here somewhere! Please, make this game stop...!! There's no point to it!"

Russian (RU): "{f:5:Бернкастель}!.. Я знаю, что вы здесь! Прошу, остановите эту игру!.. В ней нет смысла!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "{f:5:Bernkastel}‐san...! Eu sei que está aqui! Por favor, pare esse jogo...!! Não tem sentido algum!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「貝倫卡斯泰露…！你在吧，就在這某處！請別再把這遊戲，繼續下去了…！！沒有任何意義！」

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Bernkastel-san...! So che ti trovi qui da qualche parte! Ti prego, ferma questo gioco...!! Non ha senso!"

Umineko Project (UP): As if in answer to that yell, ......a black shadow appeared a few seats in front of them.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Como se em resposta ao grito, ......uma sombra preta surgiu alguns assentos de distância à frente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就像在回答這叫喊似的，……在前方隔了數個位子的椅子上，“嗉”地出現了一個黑色人影。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就像在回答这叫喊似的，……在前方隔了数个位子的椅子上，“嗉”地出现了一个黑色人影。

Steam (ST): Or perhaps she was sitting there the whole time.
Umineko Project (UP): Or perhaps she had been sitting there the whole time.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Or perhaps she had been sitting there the whole time.
PC Japanese (JP): いや、ずっとそこに座っていたのかもしれない。

Steam (ST): Maybe we just couldn't see her until we were aware of her.
Umineko Project (UP): Maybe we just couldn't see her until we realized she was there.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Maybe we just couldn't see her until we realized she was there.
PC Japanese (JP): 自分たちには、意識しない限り、その姿が見えなかっただけなのかもしれない。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Talvez nós simplesmente não conseguimos vê‐la até o momento em que percebemos que ela estava ali.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 仅仅是我们若不注意，就不会看到此人的身影也说不定。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Forse non riuscivamo a vederla finché non ci siamo resi conto che si trovasse là.

Steam (ST): It was, without a doubt, the back of {f:5:Bernkastel}'s head.
Umineko Project (UP): It was, without a doubt, the back of {f:5:Bernkastel}'s head.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was, without a doubt, the back of Bernkastel's head.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 那毫无疑问，是贝伦卡斯泰露的背影。

Umineko Project (UP): "{f:5:Bernkastel}‐san......!!"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「贝伦卡斯泰露……！！」

Umineko Project (UP): "......Pipe down back there. Can't you watch the show quietly?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Russian (RU): "......Угомонись. Ты можешь смотреть шоу спокойно?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Fecha o bico. Não consegue assistir em silêncio, não?"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……吵死了。就不能，静静地观赏吗？」

Steam (ST): The witch turned around with bored eyes. ...As though the two people yelling were the strange ones.
Umineko Project (UP): The witch turned around with bored eyes. ......As though the two who were yelling were the strange ones.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 退屈そうな瞳で振り返る魔女。……騒ぐ自分たちの方がおかしいと言わんばかりだった。
Russian (RU): Ведьма повернулась со скучающим видом. ......Как будто странными были те двое, которые кричали.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A bruxa virou‐se com olhos fastidiosos. ......Como se as pessoas gritando que fossem as problemáticas ali.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 以一副深感無趣的眼神，轉過頭來的魔女。……簡直就差說，反而是在吵的我們不正常了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 以一副深感无趣的眼神，转过头来的魔女。……简直就差说，反而是在吵的我们不正常了。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Lion
Steam (ST): "Please stop this...! We realize that this is the sealed cat box world of October 4th and 5th...!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Please stop this...! We realize that this world is the sealed cat box world of October 4th and 5th...!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「もう止めて下さい…！　この世界が、１０月４日から５日の間の、閉ざされた猫箱の世界だということは、私たちも理解しています…！」
Russian (RU): "Хватит!.. Мы и так понимаем, что этот мир — запертая кошачья коробка 4 и 5 октября!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Por favor, pare...! Nós já entendemos que esse mundo é o mundo selado da caixa de gato dos dias 4 e 5 de outubro...!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「請停止吧…！我們已經理解，這個世界是 10 月 4 日到 5 日間的，被封起來的貓箱的世界了…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「请停止吧…！我们已经理解，这个世界是 10 月 4 日到 5 日间的，被封起来的猫箱的世界了…！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Per favore, smettila...! Ci rendiamo conto che questo è il mondo della scatola del gatto sigillata del 4 e 5 Ottobre...!"

Steam (ST): The games are like messages.
Umineko Project (UP): The games are like messages.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ゲームは、メッセージと同じなのだ。
Russian (RU): Игры как послания.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os jogos são como mensagens.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 遊戲，如同訊息。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 游戏，如同讯息。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): I giochi sono come dei messaggi.

Steam (ST): Or maybe more like a roundabout love letter. A single message can be conveyed over several games.
Umineko Project (UP): Or maybe more like a roundabout love letter, conveying a single message over several games.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Or maybe more like a roundabout love letter. A single message can be conveyed over several games.
PC Japanese (JP): それはある意味、遠回しな恋文にも似る。伝えたいたった一つのことを、いくつものゲームを重ねて語る。
Russian (RU): Или, скорее, как окольное любовное письмо. Одно послание может передаваться несколько игр.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quiçá cartas de amor indiretas, transmitindo uma única mensagem ao longo de vários jogos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 它從某種意義上講，還挺像拐彎抹角的情書。累積了好幾盤遊戲地講述，她想傳達的唯一的一件事。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 它从某种意义上讲，还挺像拐弯抹角的情书。累积了好几盘游戏地讲述，她想传达的唯一的一件事。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): O forse più come una contorta lettera d'amore. Un singolo messaggio può essere trasmesso in svariati giochi.

Steam (ST): But now, we understand. We know that endless tales can seep out of the sealed, two-day cat box.
Umineko Project (UP): But we already understand. We know that endless tales can seep out of the sealed, two‐day cat box.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But now, we understand. We know that endless tales can seep out of the sealed, two-day cat box.
PC Japanese (JP): しかしもう、私たちは理解している。閉ざされた二日間の猫箱からは、無限の物語が湧き出すことを、知っている。
Russian (RU): Но теперь мы понимаем. Мы знаем, что через запертую, двухдневную кошачью коробку могут просочиться бесчисленные истории.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas nós já entendemos. Nós sabemos que esses incontáveis contos podem escoar dos dois dias da caixa de gato selada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，我們已經理解了。知道，從被封住的兩天間的貓箱，會涌出無限的故事。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，我们已经理解了。知道，从被封住的两天间的猫箱，会涌出无限的故事。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ma ora, lo comprendiamo. Sappiamo che infiniti racconti possono spuntare fuori dalla scatola del gatto sigillata di due giorni.

Steam (ST): And beyond that, I even know the culprit and the motive. That has already been revealed, and it doesn't even have anything to do with this game.
Umineko Project (UP): And beyond that, I even know the culprit and the motive. That has already been revealed, and it has nothing to do with this game.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And beyond that, I even know the culprit and the motive. That has already been revealed, and it has nothing to do with this game.
PC Japanese (JP): そしてさらに、私は犯人も動機も知っている。その上、それはすでに解明され、このゲームには関わってさえいない。
Russian (RU): И кроме того, я даже знаю преступника и мотив. Это уже раскрыто и никак не связано с этой игрой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E além disso, eu sei até mesmo quem é o culpado e seu motivo. Isso já foi revelado e não tem nenhuma relação com esse jogo.

Russian (RU): В руках были смертоносные инструменты, которыми совершили жестокую бойню.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): As mãos que carregavam utensílios da morte, com os quais ela performou seu impiedoso massacre.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 看了下，演奏了虐殺的緊握著死之工具的，這雙手。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 看了下，演奏了虐杀的紧握着死之工具的，这双手。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Quelle mani portavano oggetti di morte, che avevano portato a termine un crudele massacro.

Steam (ST): Then, at last, the murderer realized that it wouldn't even be possible to open the door like this...and tossed aside the knife...
Umineko Project (UP): At last, the murderer realized that she couldn't even open the door like this, and threw away the knife in her left hand...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, at last, the murderer realized that she couldn't even open the door like this, and threw away the knife in her left hand...
PC Japanese (JP): そしてようやく、殺人者には、扉を開けることさえ出来ないことに気付き、その左手のナイフを放り捨てる…。
Russian (RU): Затем убийца наконец поняла, что так даже не может открыть дверь, и выбросила нож из левой руки...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ao menos, a assassina percebeu que não poderia abrir a porta naquele estado e jogou longe a faca que estava em sua mão esquerda...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 接著她終於意識到了，殺人者就連開個門都做不到，扔掉了左手的匕首…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 接着她终于意识到了，杀人者就连开个门都做不到，扔掉了左手的匕首…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): In seguito, alla fine, l'assassina realizzò che in quel modo non poteva nemmeno aprire la porta, e buttò via il coltello dalla sua mano sinistra...

Steam (ST): Then, the murderer reached out to the door, turned around calmly, ...and spoke.
Umineko Project (UP): Then, she placed her hand on the door, turned around calmly, ......and spoke.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, she placed her hand on the door, turned around calmly, ......and spoke.
PC Japanese (JP): そして扉に手を掛けながら、悠然と振り返り、……言った。
Russian (RU): А потом положила руку на дверную ручку, спокойно повернула её...... и сказала.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, ela colocou sua mão sobre a porta, virou‐se calmamente, ......vociferando.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後，她把手放到了門上，悠然轉身，……張口說道。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后，她把手放到了门上，悠然转身，……张口说道。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Poi, mise la sua mano sulla porta, si voltò con calma... e parlò.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kyrie
Steam (ST): "Sorry, everyone. ...But don't worry. A few days later, the newspapers will be talking about an unfortunate accident. ...And I'm sure the news shows, the papers, and rumormongers everywhere will be sure that you spent your time in happy ignorance until the instant of the accident. ...In other words, you'll all have had a good time until midnight on October 5th."
Umineko Project (UP): "Sorry, everyone. ......But don't worry. In a few days, the newspapers will be talking about an unfortunate accident. ......And I'm sure the news shows, newspapers, and all the rumor‐spreading people will say that you must have spent your time in happy ignorance until the instant of the accident. ......In other words, that'll mean you all had a good time until midnight on October 5th."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Sorry, everyone. ......But don't worry. A few days later, the newspapers will be talking about an unfortunate accident. ......And I'm sure the news shows, newspapers, and all the rumor-spreading people will be sure that you spent your time in happy ignorance until the instant of the accident. ......In other words, that'll mean you all had a good time until midnight on October 5th."
PC Japanese (JP): 「ごめんね、みんな。……でも安心してね。数日後、新聞は不幸な事故を掲載するわ。……そしてあなたたちは、事故の瞬間まで、何も知らずに楽しく過ごしていたに違いないと、新聞もニュースも、噂する人々も言うでしょうね。……それはつまり、あなたたちは、１０月５日の２４時まで、楽しく過ごしていたということ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ごめんね、みんな。……でも安心してね。数日後、新聞は不幸な事故を掲載するわ。……そしてあなたたちは、事故の瞬間まで、何も知らずに楽しく過ごしていたに違いないと、新聞もニュースも、噂する人々も言うでしょうね。……それはつまり、あなたたちは、１０月５日の２４時まで、楽しく過ごしていたということ」
Russian (RU): "Извините. ......Но не волнуйтесь. Спустя несколько дней в газетах начнут писать о несчастном случае. ......И наверняка новостные программы, газеты и все те люди, распространяющие слухи, будут уверены, что до момента несчастного случая вы пребывали в счастливом неведении. ......В общем, получится, что до полуночи 5 октября вы хорошо провели время."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Desculpa, pessoal. ......Mas não se preocupem. Em alguns dias, os jornais vão estar falando sobre um infortuno acidente. ......Tenho certeza que os noticiários, os jornais e todos os fofoqueiros de plantão vão estar falando que vocês passaram o tempo completamente ignorantes, contentes até instante do acidente. ......Em outras palavras, isso significa que vocês se divertiram muito até a meia‐noite do dia 5 de outubro."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「對不起哦，諸位。……但是請放心。幾天後，報上就會刊登不幸的事故了。……並且，在發生事故的那一瞬間之前，你們無疑什麼都不知道，開開心心地度過了那段時間，報紙、新聞、還有以此為談資的人們都會這麼說吧。……這也就代表著，直到 10 月 5 日的 24 點，你們開開心心地度過了這之前的那一段時間。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「对不起哦，诸位。……但是请放心。几天后，报上就会刊登不幸的事故了。……并且，在发生事故的那一瞬间之前，你们无疑什么都不知道，开开心心地度过了那段时间，报纸、新闻、还有以此为谈资的人们都会这么说吧。……这也就代表着，直到 10 月 5 日的 24 点，你们开开心心地度过了这之前的那一段时间。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Mi spiace, gente. ... Ma non preoccupatevi. Tra pochi giorni, i giornali parleranno di uno sfortunato incidente. ... E sicuramente i telegiornali, i giornali, e tutti i pettegoli saranno certi che abbiate speso i vostri momenti in una felice ignoranza fino all'istante dell'incidente. ... In altre parole, vorrà dire che tutti voi vi sarete divertiti fino alla mezzanotte del 5 Ottobre."

Steam (ST): So said the one who had stained that bloody guesthouse red.
Umineko Project (UP): So said the one who had stained the guesthouse red.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): この惨劇の、血に染まったゲストハウスにした張本人が、そう口にする。
Russian (RU): Так сказала та, кто запятнала домик для гостей красным.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Assim disse aquela que pintou a casa de hóspedes de vermelho.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 犯下這場慘劇，血洗賓館的罪魁禍首，如此說道。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 犯下这场惨剧，血洗宾馆的罪魁祸首，如此说道。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Così disse colei che aveva macchiato di rosso la casa degli ospiti.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kyrie
Steam (ST): "At this hour, the cousins are all staying up late and playing around. ...And the servants who have to get up early are all snoring. The ones on the late shift are probably filling in the log or taking a break about now."
Umineko Project (UP): "At this hour, the cousins are all staying up late and playing around. ......The servants who have the morning shift are all snoring. The ones on the late shift are probably filling in the log or taking a break about now."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「この時間には、いとこ同士で楽しくはしゃいで夜更かしをしている。……そして朝が早い使用人の人は高いびき。遅番の人は日誌でも書いて、あるいはほっと一息を入れてる頃でしょうね。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「この時間には、いとこ同士で楽しくはしゃいで夜更かしをしている。……そして朝が早い使用人の人は高いびき。遅番の人は日誌でも書いて、あるいはほっと一息を入れてる頃でしょうね」
Russian (RU): "В этот час кузены засиделись допоздна и играют. ......Все слуги, у которых утренняя смена, храпят. Те, кто на ночной смене, сейчас заполняют журнал или отдыхают."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Nessa hora, os primos vão estar todos acordados e brincando. ......Os serviçais que trabalham pela manhã estarão roncando. Aqueles relacionados para o turno da noite certamente estarão preenchendo planilhas ou fazendo um intervalo agora."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「現在這時間，堂兄妹們正在熬夜不睡地開心玩鬧。……而要早起的傭人則是鼾聲如雷。值晚班的人正在寫日志，或在鬆口氣放鬆吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「现在这时间，堂兄妹们正在熬夜不睡地开心玩闹。……而要早起的佣人则是鼾声如雷。值晚班的人正在写日志，或在松口气放松吧。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "A quest'ora, i cugini staranno in piedi fino a tardi giocando. ... I domestici che hanno il turno mattutino staranno russando. Quelli del turno di notte, probabilmente, staranno compilando il registro o prendendosi una pausa ora."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kyrie
Steam (ST): "...That's how it is. From where I am now, I can hear laughter coming from the cousin room. ......*giggle*."
Umineko Project (UP): ".........That's how it is. From where I am now, I can hear the laughter coming from the cousins' room. ...............*giggle*."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......That's how it is. From where I am now, I can hear the laughter coming from the cousins' room. ............*giggle*."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………そういうことなの。ここでこうしていると、いとこ部屋での大はしゃぎが聞こえてくるようだわ。……………くす。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………そういうことなの。ここでこうしていると、いとこ部屋での大はしゃぎが聞こえてくるようだわ。……………くす」
Russian (RU): "......Вот так. Оттуда, где стою, я слышу смех из комнаты кузенов. ............*хи‐хи*."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........É assim que vai ser. De onde estou agora, eu posso ouvir as risadas vindo do quarto dos primos. ...............*risos*."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………就是這麼一回事哦。在這像這樣待著，都感覺能聽到堂兄妹房間中的大肆玩鬧的聲音了呢。……………呵。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………就是这么一回事哦。在这像这样待着，都感觉能听到堂兄妹房间中的大肆玩闹的声音了呢。……………呵。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... È così. Dal punto in cui mi trovo ora, posso sentire le risate provenienti dalla stanza dei cugini. ... *giggle*."

Steam (ST): Humans outside the cat box would probably never understand what Kyrie was saying.
Umineko Project (UP): Humans outside the cat box would probably never understand what Kyrie was saying.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 霧江が何を言っているのか、猫箱の外の人間たちには、永遠にわかるまい。
Russian (RU): Люди за пределами кошачьей коробки никогда не поймут того, что сказала Кирие.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Humanos fora da caixa de gato provavelmente nunca entenderiam o que Kyrie estava dizendo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在貓箱外的人，永遠都不會懂得，霧江在說些什麼。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在猫箱外的人，永远都不会懂得，雾江在说些什么。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): È probabile che gli umani all'esterno della scatola del gatto non avrebbero mai capito ciò che stava dicendo Kyrie.

Steam (ST): Only she, shut inside the cat box of the explosion accident, could know what it really meant...
Umineko Project (UP): Only she, shut inside the cat box of the explosion accident, could understand the true meaning of her words......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Only she, shut inside the cat box of the explosion accident, could understand the true meaning of her words......
PC Japanese (JP): 爆発事故という猫箱で閉ざす彼女だけが、その真の意味を理解している……。
Russian (RU): Только она, запертая в коробке непреднамеренного взрыва, понимала истинное значение своих слов......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Apenas ela, presa dentro da caixa de gato da explosão acidental, poderia entender o verdadeiro significado de suas palavras......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 只有用“爆炸事故”這個貓箱把一切封起來了的她，明白這真正的意義……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 只有用“爆炸事故”这个猫箱把一切封起来了的她，明白这真正的意义……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Solo lei, rinchiusa nella scatola del gatto dell'incidente dell'esplosione, poteva comprendere il vero significato delle sue parole...

Steam (ST): Outside, the rain poured down heavily.
Umineko Project (UP): Outside, the rain poured down heavily.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Outside, the rain poured down heavily.
PC Japanese (JP): 外は土砂降りの雨だった。
Russian (RU): Снаружи лил проливной дождь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Do lado de fora, a chuva caía com força.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 外面下著傾盆大雨。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 外面下着倾盆大雨。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Fuori, la pioggia cadeva incessantemente.

Steam (ST): Kyrie almost picked up an umbrella, but then stopped suddenly, as if she'd just thought of something.
Umineko Project (UP): Kyrie almost picked up an umbrella, but then stopped suddenly, as if she'd just thought of something.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Kyrie almost picked up an umbrella, but then stopped suddenly, as if she'd just thought of something.
PC Japanese (JP): 霧江は傘を取ろうとしたが、ふと、何かを思い付いたように手を止める。
Russian (RU): Кирие почти подняла зонтик, как вдруг остановилась, словно что‐то надумав.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Kyrie quase pegou um guarda‐chuva, mas parou de repente, como se tivesse acabado de lembrar de uma alguma coisa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然霧江想去拿傘，但馬上她就像忽然想到什麼似地停了手。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然雾江想去拿伞，但马上她就像忽然想到什么似地停了手。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Kyrie stava per prendere un ombrello, ma si fermò all'improvviso, come se le fosse venuto qualcosa in mente.

Steam (ST): Then, she started walking out into the rain, not caring at all whether she got wet or not...
Umineko Project (UP): Then, she started walking out into the rain, not caring at all whether she got wet or not...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Then, she started walking out into the rain, not caring at all whether she got wet or not...
PC Japanese (JP): そして、濡れるのも気にせず、そのまま雨の中へ歩き出す…。
Russian (RU): Затем она вышла под дождь, не заботясь о том, промокнет ли...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Então, ela começou a caminhar na chuva, sem se importar se acabaria encharcada...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 接著，她不顧自己被淋濕，就這麼朝雨中走去…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 接着，她不顾自己被淋湿，就这么朝雨中走去…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Poi, iniziò a camminare sotto la pioggia, senza preoccuparsi del fatto che si potesse bagnare...

Steam (ST): Did the murderer not want an umbrella to get in the way of her gun? ...Or was she hoping that the rain could act as a shower to get the blood off her?
Umineko Project (UP): Did the murderer not want an umbrella to get in the way of her pointing her gun? ......Or was she hoping that the rain could act as a shower to get the blood off her?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Did the murderer not want an umbrella to get in the way of pointing her gun? ......Or was she hoping that the rain could act as a shower to get the blood off her?
PC Japanese (JP): 殺人鬼は、銃を構えるために、片手を傘で塞ぎたくなかったのか。……あるいは、返り血を雨のシャワーで落とそうと考えたのか、……どちらかはわからない。
Russian (RU): Убийца не хотела, чтобы зонтик помешал ей наставить ружьё? ......Или же она надеялась, что дождь может стать душем, который смоет с неё кровь?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Poderia ser que a assassina não quisesse ter uma guarda‐chuva atrapalhando sua mira? ......Ou estaria ela esperando que a chuva pudesse atuar como um chuveiro para escorrer o sangue impregnado nele?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 殺人魔，是為了能舉起槍，才不願把一只手浪費在傘上嗎？……又或者是，她是想用雨的淋浴來沖掉身上的受害人的血嗎，……搞不懂，究竟是哪個。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 杀人魔，是为了能举起枪，才不愿把一只手浪费在伞上吗？……又或者是，她是想用雨的淋浴来冲掉身上的受害人的血吗，……搞不懂，究竟是哪个。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): L'assassina non voleva che un ombrello la intralciasse nel prendere la mira? {n}O forse stava sperando che la pioggia potesse agire come doccia per toglierle il sangue di dosso?

Foi salva por um disparo acidental, só isso. .........Se não fosse aquela boa sorte, e se eu não tivesse agido antes de vocês, ......agora você estaria fazendo exatamente o papel que estou fazendo agora. Isso é um fato — a verdade de um futuro alternativo — e isso não vai mudar, não importa o quanto tente negar."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「不。你只是就差了一步的，十足的殺人魔喲。繪羽姐姐只是被槍支走火拉了一把罷了。………要是沒那幸運，而且我也沒先於你付諸實行的話。……你就在扮演我的角色了。唯獨此事是，不管你怎麼否定都不會改變的，另一個未來的，真實喲。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「不。你只是就差了一步的，十足的杀人魔哟。绘羽姐姐只是被枪支走火拉了一把罢了。………要是没那幸运，而且我也没先于你付诸实行的话。……你就在扮演我的角色了。唯独此事是，不管你怎么否定都不会改变的，另一个未来的，真实哟。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "No. Sei solo un'assassina che non ha ricevuto una chance. Sei stata solo salvata da quel colpo accidentale. ... Se non fosse stato per quel poco di buona fortuna, e se non mi fossi mossa prima di te... avresti recitato la stessa parte che ora recito io. Questo fatto non cambia, per quanto tu provi a negarlo. È una verità che esiste attraverso tutti i futuri."

Steam (ST): If the argument had continued much longer, she would surely have grown a desire to kill Krauss and the others, and might even have carried it out.
Umineko Project (UP): If the argument had continued much longer, she would surely have grown a desire to kill Krauss and the others, and might even have carried it out.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If the argument had continued much longer, she would surely have grown a desire to kill Krauss and the others, and might even have carried it out.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Ela simplesmente não podia negar a existência desse demônio habitando as profundezas de seu coração.

Russian (RU): Только театралы знали.{n}Знали, что в другом мире она могла стать убийцей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Apenas os espectadores sabiam.{n}Eles sabiam que ela poderia se tornar uma assassina em outra possibilidade de mundo.

Umineko Project (UP): So, for some time, Eva could only grind her teeth in silence, still pointing her gun......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, for some time, Eva could only grind her teeth in silence, still pointing her gun......

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva
Steam (ST): "...I don't understand. You're also a mother. You've felt the pain of giving birth to your own child. How can you not know how precious a life is...?! How are you capable of doing all this...?!"
Umineko Project (UP): "......I don't understand. You're also a mother, you've felt the pain of giving birth to your own child. How can you not know how precious a life is...?! How are you capable of doing all this...?!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......I don't understand. You're also a mother. You've felt the pain of giving birth to your own child. How can you not know how precious a life is...?! How are you capable of doing all this...?!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「……私にはわからないわ。あなたも、自分のお腹を痛めて子を生んだ経験を持つ、母のはず。命の尊さを、知らないわけがない…！　そのあなたがどうして、これだけのことが出来るの…！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……私にはわからないわ。あなたも、自分のお腹を痛めて子を産んだ経験を持つ、母のはず。命の尊さを、知らないわけがない…！　そのあなたがどうして、これだけのことが出来るの…！」
Russian (RU): "......Я не понимаю. Ты тоже мать. Ты страдала, рождая на свет своего ребёнка. Тебе ли не знать, насколько драгоценна жизнь?! Как ты можешь делать такое?!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Eu não entendo. Você também é mãe, sentiu a dor de dar à luz a sua filha. Como não consegue compreender o valor de uma vida...?! Como é capaz de fazer tudo isso...?!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……我搞不懂你。你也理應是個，經歷過生下弄疼自己肚子的小孩的，母親。不可能不知道，生命有多寶貴…！這樣的你，為什麼能做出這種事來…？！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……我搞不懂你。你也理应是个，经历过生下弄疼自己肚子的小孩的，母亲。不可能不知道，生命有多宝贵…！这样的你，为什么能做出这种事来…？！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Non capisco. Anche tu sei una Madre. Hai sentito il dolore di dare alla luce un figlio. Come puoi non sapere quanto sia preziosa una vita...?! Come puoi fare tutto ciò...?!"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kyrie
Steam (ST): "Children are bonds used to tie you to your husband. ...She was a bond to make Rudolf-san acknowledge me, so I could take him back from that woman."
Umineko Project (UP): "Children are bonds that can tie you to your husband. ......In my case, a bond to make Rudolf‐san acknowledge me, so I could take him back from that woman."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Children are bonds that can tie you to your husband. ......A bond to make Rudolf-san acknowledge me, so I could take him back from that woman."
PC Japanese (JP): 「子は、夫を繋ぎ止めておくための、かすがいなのよ。……留弗夫さんに、私のことを認めさせ、あの女から彼を取り戻すための、かすがいだった。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「子は、夫を繋ぎ止めておくための、かすがいなのよ。……留弗夫さんに、私のことを認めさせ、あの女から彼を取り戻すための、かすがいだった」
Russian (RU): "Дети — связи, которые связывают тебя с мужем. ......Связь, благодаря которой я заставила Рудольфа признать меня и отняла его у той женщины."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Crianças são laços que podem juntá‐la com seu marido. ......No meu caso, um laço para fazer com que o Rudolf‐san me reconhecesse, para que assim eu pudesse recuperá‐lo daquela mulher."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「孩子是為了把丈夫留在身邊的，一把連心鎖喲。……是一把，令留弗夫認可我，把他從那女人身邊搶回來的，連心鎖。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「孩子是为了把丈夫留在身边的，一把连心锁哟。……是一把，令留弗夫认可我，把他从那女人身边抢回来的，连心锁。」

Umineko Project (UP): "What do you mean......I understand?!"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kyrie
Steam (ST): "Just that right now, I'm the wife of no man, and I have no intention of being a mother. ...I am me. Kyrie. Now that Rudolf-san's dead, I'm not even an Ushiromiya anymore. I live to benefit me."
Umineko Project (UP): "Right now, I'm no man's wife, so there's no need for me to be a mother. ......I am me. Kyrie. Now that Rudolf‐san's dead, I'm not even an Ushiromiya anymore. I live to benefit me."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Right now, I'm no man's wife, so there's no need for me to be a mother. ......I am me. Kyrie. Now that Rudolf-san's dead, I'm not even an Ushiromiya anymore. I live to benefit me."
PC Japanese (JP): 「私はもう。誰かの妻でもないし、母のつもりもない、ということよ。……私は私。霧江。留弗夫さんが死んだ今、右代宮でさえないわ。私は私の、得になるように生きる。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「私はもう。誰かの妻でもないし、母のつもりもない、ということよ。……私は私。霧江。留弗夫さんが死んだ今、右代宮でさえないわ。私は私の、得になるように生きる」
Russian (RU): "Сейчас я не жена, поэтому мне не нужно быть матерью. ......Я — это я. Кирие. Раз Рудольф мёртв, я уже даже не Уширомия. Я живу ради себя."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Agora, eu não sou esposa de ninguém, logo não é necessário ser mãe. ......Sou apenas eu. Kyrie. Agora que o Rudolf‐san está morto, eu sequer sou mais uma Ushiromiya. Eu vivo para me beneficiar."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「也就是說，我已經，不是任何人的妻子，也不打算當媽了。……我就是我。霧江。在留弗夫死了的現在，我連右代宮都不是。我為我的利益而活。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「也就是说，我已经，不是任何人的妻子，也不打算当妈了。……我就是我。雾江。在留弗夫死了的现在，我连右代宫都不是。我为我的利益而活。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "In questo momento, non sono la moglie di nessuno, perciò non ho bisogno di essere una Madre. ... Io sono io. Kyrie. Ora che Rudolf-san è morto, non sono più nemmeno una Ushiromiya. Vivo solo per il mio bene."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Eva
Steam (ST): "Right, Rudolf is dead, so maybe you aren't a wife anymore. But you still have Ange-chan, don't you...?! You're still a mother, aren't you...?!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Right, Rudolf is dead, so maybe you aren't a wife anymore. But you still have Ange‐chan, right...?! You're still a mother, aren't you...?!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Right, Rudolf is dead, so maybe you aren't a wife anymore. But you still have Ange-chan, right...?! You're still a mother, aren't you...?!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「そうね、留弗夫は死んで、あんたは妻ではなくなったかもしれない。でも、縁寿ちゃんがいるでしょう…？！　あんたはまだ、母であり続けるはずよ…！」
Russian (RU): "Да, Рудольф умер и ты больше не жена. Но у тебя ведь осталась Энджи?! Ты до сих пор мать, так?!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sim, o Rudolf está morto, então você não é mais esposa dele. Mas ainda tem a Ange‐chan, lembra...?! Você ainda é mãe, sabia...?!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「是的，因留弗夫死了，所以你不再是妻子了也說不定。但是，你還有小緣壽吧…？！你理應仍是個母親…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「是的，因留弗夫死了，所以你不再是妻子了也说不定。但是，你还有小缘寿吧…？！你理应仍是个母亲…！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Sì, Rudolf è morto, perciò forse non sarai più una moglie. Ma hai ancora Ange-chan, no...?! Sei ancora una Madre, non è così...?!"

Steam (ST): "Didn't you hear what I just said about bonds? Now that Rudolf-san is gone, Ange is of no use to me."
Umineko Project (UP): "Didn't you hear what I just said about bonds? Now that Rudolf‐san is gone, Ange is of no use to me."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Didn't you hear what I just said about bonds? Now that Rudolf-san is gone, Ange is of no use to me."

Umineko Project (UP): But saying that did nothing to calm Ange's sobs.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas dizer isso não foi capaz de acalmar os lamentos da Ange.

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Ma dire ciò non fece nulla per calmare i singhiozzi di Ange.

Steam (ST): I don't blame her. Even if she knows it's just a game, ...she's been forced to see, not only her mother's death, ...but also her mother announcing that she was the culprit of a mass murder, who didn't even love her own daughter. Anyone would sob after hearing that...
Umineko Project (UP): I don't blame her. Even if she knows it's just a game, ......she's been forced to see not only her mother's death, ......but also her mother announcing that she was the culprit of a mass murder, who didn't even love her daughter. Anyone would sob after hearing that...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I don't blame her. Even if she knows it's just a game, ......she's been forced to see, not only her mother's death, ......but also her mother announcing that she was the culprit of a mass murder, who didn't even love her daughter. Anyone would sob after hearing that...
PC Japanese (JP): 無理もない。いくらゲームだとわかっていても、……母親の死ぬところだけでなく、……母親が大量殺人の犯人で、さらにその上、娘を愛していないとまで言い切られるところを見せられれば、誰だって泣き叫ぶだろう…。
Russian (RU): Я не виню её. Даже если она знает, что это всего лишь игра...... её вынудили смотреть не только на смерть матери...... но ещё и на то, как её мать объявила себя виновником массового убийства и сказала, что даже не любила свою дочь. Любой бы зарыдал, услышав такое...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu não a culpo. Mesmo que ela saiba que é apenas um jogo, ......ela não foi simplesmente forçada a assistir a morte de sua mãe, ......mas também ver sua mãe anunciando que era a culpada do assassinato em massa, dizendo que sequer amava sua própria filha. Qualquer um choraria ao ouvir isso...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這也難免。再怎麼說，明白這是一盤遊戲，……不僅僅是母親死去的情景，……母親是大量殺人的凶手，豈止如此，連她能斷言她不愛自己女兒的情景，都被亮在了自己眼前，無論誰都會大聲哭喊吧…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这也难免。再怎么说，明白这是一盘游戏，……不仅仅是母亲死去的情景，……母亲是大量杀人的凶手，岂止如此，连她能断言她不爱自己女儿的情景，都被亮在了自己眼前，无论谁都会大声哭喊吧…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Non la biasimo. Nonostante sappia che è solamente un gioco... è stata forzata a vedere, non solo la morte di sua Madre... ma anche sua Madre che annunciava di essere il colpevole di un omicidio di massa, che non amava nemmeno sua figlia. Chiunque piangerebbe dopo aver sentito ciò...

Speaker: Ushiromiya Lion
Steam (ST): "{f:5:Bernkastel}-san!! Enough of this!! I don't care who the Game Master is!! Stop this pointless game right now!!"
Umineko Project (UP): "{f:5:Bernkastel}‐san!! Enough of this!! I don't care who the Game Master is!! Stop this pointless game right now!!"

PC Japanese (JP): 「ベルンカステルさん！！　もういい加減にして下さい！！　誰がゲームマスターだろうと、知ったことじゃない！！　今すぐ、この無意味なゲームを終わりにして下さいッ！！」
Russian (RU): "{f:5:Бернкастель}! Хватит! Мне всё равно, кто Владелец игры! Сейчас же остановите эту бессмысленную игру!"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「贝伦卡斯泰露！！请适可而止吧！！我才不管谁是 GM！！请立刻停止这场毫无意义的游戏！！」

Umineko Project (UP): However, that wasn't enough to shock Lion.

Speaker: {f:5:Bernkastel}
Steam (ST): "...When they're alive, you can enjoy watching them struggle. When they're dead, you can enjoy tearing out their guts. Tales are things you get to enjoy twice. ...That's what it means to be a witch of theatergoing."

PC Japanese (JP): 「………生きては、その足掻きを愛でる。死んでは、ワタを掻き出して愛でる。物語は、二度楽しめるのよ。……それが、観劇の魔女というもの。」

Steam (ST): "That's right. The riddle of the epitaph. ......As you can tell by the mechanism set into the chapel, Kinzo thought up the epitaph trick near the beginning, when the mansion on Rokkenjima was being built. ...He had the romantic idea of someday using it as a test to select his successor."
Umineko Project (UP): "That's right. The riddle of the epitaph. .........As you can tell by the mechanism set into the chapel, Kinzo thought up the epitaph trick near the beginning, when the mansion on Rokkenjima was being built. ......He had the romantic idea of someday using it as a test to select the next head."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「そうよ。碑文の謎よ。………礼拝堂の仕掛けを見ればわかる通り、金蔵は碑文の仕掛けを、六軒島に屋敷を築いたその当初から考えていたわ。……いつか、次期当主を選ぶ試練に使えるかもしれないなんて、ロマンチックなことを考えながらね。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そうよ。碑文の謎よ。………礼拝堂の仕掛けを見ればわかる通り、金蔵は碑文の仕掛けを、六軒島に屋敷を築いたその当初から考えていたわ。……いつか、次期当主を選ぶ試練に使えるかもしれないなんて、ロマンチックなことを考えながらね」
Russian (RU): "Верно. Загадку эпитафии. .........Как видно по механизму в часовне, Кинзо придумал трюк с эпитафией практически в самом начале, когда на Роккенджиме ещё строили особняк. ......У него возникла романтическая идея однажды таким образом выбрать следующего главу."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Isso mesmo. O enigma do epitáfio. .........Como pode ver pelo mecanismo colocado na capela, Kinzo pensou no truque do epitáfio logo no começo, quando a mansão estava sendo construída em Rokkenjima. ......Ele tinha uma ideia romântica de algum dia usá‐lo como teste para escolher seu sucessor."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「是喲。是碑文之謎喲。………就像只要看了禮拜堂的機關就會想到的一樣，金藏是從當初在六軒島建大屋時起，就想好了碑文的機關。……他那時富有浪漫色彩地想著，將來有一天，或許能在選出下任當主的考驗中用到它吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「是哟。是碑文之谜哟。………就像只要看了礼拜堂的机关就会想到的一样，金藏是从当初在六轩岛建大屋时起，就想好了碑文的机关。……他那时富有浪漫色彩地想着，将来有一天，或许能在选出下任当主的考验中用到它吧。」

Come si può capire dal meccanismo della cappella, Kinzo aveva pensato il congegno dell'epigrafe sin dall'inizio, quando la villa su Rokkenjima stava venendo costruita. ... Aveva l'idea romantica di usarlo un giorno come prova per selezionare il prossimo capofamiglia."

PC Japanese (JP): 「………つまりあなたの、いいえ、あなたたちの運命は、２５７万８９１７分の２５７万８９１７の確率で、………つまり如何なる奇跡も許されない絶対の運命で、逃れ得ぬ袋小路に、運命の牢獄に囚われているということなのよ！
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………つまりあなたの、いいえ、あなたたちの運命は、２５７万８９１７分の２５７万８９１７の確率で、………つまり如何なる奇跡も許さない絶対の運命で、逃れ得ぬ袋小路に、運命の牢獄に囚われているということなのよ！」
Russian (RU): "......В общем, твоя судьба... нет, судьба, разделённая вами двумя...... ловит вас в неизбежный тупик — в ад судьбы — с вероятностью 2578917 из 2578917. Если перефразировать, это абсолютная судьба без всяких шансов на чудо!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Em outros mundos, seu destino — não, o destino que compartilham — aprisiona você em um inescapável beco sem saída, um destino infernal, com uma probabilidade de 2.578.917 em 2.578.917. .........Simplificando, é um destino certo, com absolutamente nenhuma margem para milagres!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………也就是說，你的、不，你們的命運，是會以 257 萬 8917 分之 257 萬 8917 的概率，………換言之，你們因沒有任何奇跡的絕對的命運，而被囚禁在了逃不掉的死胡同，命運的監牢！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………也就是说，你的、不，你们的命运，是会以 257 万 8917 分之 257 万 8917 的概率，………换言之，你们因没有任何奇迹的绝对的命运，而被囚禁在了逃不掉的死胡同，命运的监牢！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Negli altri mondi, il tuo destino... no, il destino che voi due condividete{n}ti intrappola in un vicolo cieco inevitabile, un fato infernale, con una probabilità di 2. 578. 917 su 2. 578. 917. Per metterla in altro modo, è un fato certo, senza alcuna possibilità di miracolo!

Steam (ST): Just when a bright light seemed to turn the world white, the scene suddenly changed back to the theater.
Umineko Project (UP): A bright light seemed to turn the world white—then, the next moment, they were back in the theater.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Just when a bright light seemed to turn the world white, the scene suddenly changed back to the theater.
PC Japanese (JP): 眩しい光に世界が真っ白に染まったかと思うと、次の瞬間には再び、あの劇場に戻っていた。
Russian (RU): Как только мир побелел от яркого света, сцена вдруг перешла обратно в театр.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Uma brilhante luz pareceu tingir o mundo de branco — então, no instante seguinte, estavam de volta ao teatro.

Umineko Project (UP): As Clair stood absolutely still on the stage, the tip of {f:5:Bernkastel}'s reaper scythe traced a line across her stomach.

PC Japanese (JP): 舞台の上で、ベルンカステルは死神の鎌の切っ先で、立ち尽くすクレルの亡骸の下腹をなぞる。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com Clair ainda sobre o palco, a ponta da foice de {f:5:Bernkastel} traçou uma linha em seu estômago.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在舞台上，貝倫卡斯泰露用死神之鐮的刀鋒，划了下始終站著的克蕾爾的屍骸的小腹。

Steam (ST): A red line was drawn across the white skin, exposed now that the dress had been cut, and black blood began to seep out...
Umineko Project (UP): A red line was drawn across her white skin, exposed now that the dress had been cut, and black blood began to seep out......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): A red line was drawn across the white skin, exposed now that the dress had been cut, and black blood began to seep out......
PC Japanese (JP): ドレスが裂けて露になった白い肌に、赤い線がなぞられ、そこから黒い血が滲み出す……。
Russian (RU): Когда платье было порезано, показалась красная линия, проведённая по белой коже, и начала просачиваться тёмная кровь......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Uma linha vermelha foi traçada em sua pele branca, exposta agora que o vestido havia sido cortado, fazendo sangue negro escorrer para fora......

Speaker: {f:5:Bernkastel}
Steam (ST): "{f:5:Beatrice}. Trapped in that inescapable, certain, locked-away pair of days, you became a witch who could give birth to endless possibilities within that two-day cat box. ...In exchange, it was absolutely certain that you would not be saved or rewarded.
Umineko Project (UP): "{f:5:Beatrice}. Trapped in that inescapable, certain, locked‐away pair of days, you became a witch who could give birth to endless possibilities within that two‐day cat box. ......In exchange, it was absolutely certain that you would not be saved or rewarded."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Beatrice. Trapped in that inescapable, certain, locked-away pair of days, you became a witch who could give birth to endless possibilities within that two-day cat box. ......In exchange, it was absolutely certain that you would not be saved or rewarded.
PC Japanese (JP): 「ベアトリーチェ。閉ざされた、逃げ得ぬ絶対の二日間に閉じ込められたあなたは、その二日間の猫箱の中で無限を生み出せる魔女となったわ。……絶対に救われない、報われないことと引き換えにね。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ベアトリーチェ。閉ざされた、逃げ得ぬ絶対の二日間に閉じ込められたあなたは、その二日間の猫箱の中で無限を生み出せる魔女となったわ。……絶対に救われない、報われないことと引き換えにね」
Russian (RU): "{f:5:Беатриче}. Захваченная в неизбежную, абсолютную, запертую пару дней, ты стала ведьмой, способной в этой двухдневной кошачьей коробке дать начало бесчисленным возможностям. ......Взамен ты абсолютно точно не была бы спасена или вознаграждена."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "{f:5:Beatrice}. Aprisionada em um inescapável e absoluto par de dias trancafiados, você se tornou uma bruxa capaz de dar à luz a infinitas possibilidades dentro dessa caixa de gato de dois dias. ......Em troca, era absolutamente certo que você não seria salva ou recompensada."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「貝阿朵莉切。被關進遭封閉起來的，無路可逃的絕對的兩天間的你，成為了能在這兩天間的貓箱中創造出無限的魔女。……以絕對不會得救，絕對不會得到回報為代價。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「贝阿朵莉切。被关进遭封闭起来的，无路可逃的绝对的两天间的你，成为了能在这两天间的猫箱中创造出无限的魔女。……以绝对不会得救，绝对不会得到回报为代价。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Beatrice. Intrappolata in un paio di giorni inevitabili, certi e sigillati, sei diventata una strega che poteva dar vita ad infinite possibilità all'interno di quella scatola del gatto di due giorni. ... In cambio, era assolutamente certo che tu non saresti stata salvata o premiata.

Speaker: {f:5:Bernkastel}
Steam (ST): However, you had a dream. ...You dreamed of Ushiromiya Lion. ...You consoled yourself with the thought of a miracle world, where you could've lived in happiness without ever becoming Clair!"
Umineko Project (UP): "However, you had a dream. ......You dreamed of Ushiromiya Lion. .........You consoled yourself with the thought of a miracle world, where you could have lived in happiness and would never have become Clair!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, you had a dream. ......You dreamed of Ushiromiya Lion. ......You consoled yourself with the thought of a miracle world, where you could have lived in happiness and would never have become Clair!"
PC Japanese (JP): しかしあなたは夢を見たわ。……それが右代宮理御という夢。………自分がクレルとならずに済み、幸せに暮らせていたかもしれない奇跡の世界を夢見て自らを慰めていた！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「しかしあなたは夢を見たわ。……それが右代宮理御という夢。………自分がクレルとならずに済み、幸せに暮らせていたかもしれない奇跡の世界を夢見て自らを慰めていた！」
Russian (RU): "Но у тебя была мечта. ......Уширомия Лион. ......Ты утешала себя мыслью о чудесном мире, где ты могла бы жить счастливо и никогда не становиться Клэр!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Porém, você teve um sonho. ......Você sonhou com Ushiromiya Lion. .........Consolou a si mesma com a crença de um mundo milagroso, no qual poderia viver sua felicidade e nunca se tornaria Clair!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「然而，你做了一個夢。……這是一個叫，右代宮理御的夢。………夢想著，自己或許能不用成為克蕾爾，說不定能生活在幸福中的奇跡的世界，以此來安慰自己！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「然而，你做了一个梦。……这是一个叫，右代宫理御的梦。………梦想着，自己或许能不用成为克蕾尔，说不定能生活在幸福中的奇迹的世界，以此来安慰自己！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tuttavia, avevi un sogno. ... Sognavi Ushiromiya Lion. ... Ti consolavi col pensiero di un mondo miracolo, dove avresti potuto vivere in felicità e non saresti mai diventata Clair!"

Speaker: {f:5:Bernkastel}
Steam (ST): "......I had to work hard to find Lion. Just as Beato dreamed, Lion's existence is a true miracle. And, at the end of your funeral, I wanted to show you. ...To show you that, even with that miracle, you couldn't have escaped from tragedy!!"
Umineko Project (UP): ".........I really had to work hard to find Lion. As Beato dreamed, Lion's existence was a true miracle. And, at the end of your funeral, I wanted to show you. .........That even {i:with} that miracle, you couldn't have escaped this tragedy!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........I had to work hard to find Lion. As Beato dreamed, Lion's existence is a true miracle. And, at the end of your funeral, I wanted to show you. ......To show you that, even with that miracle, you couldn't have escaped this tragedy!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「………理御を見つけるのは本当に苦労したわよ。その存在は、ベアトが夢見た通り、本当に奇跡だったんだから。そして、葬儀の最後に見せ付けてやりたかったのよ。………その奇跡をもってしても、あんたは惨劇を逃れられやしないってね！！」
Russian (RU): ".........С трудом, но я отыскала такой фрагмент. Как мечтала Беато, Лион — истинное чудо. И под конец твоих похорон я хотела показать тебе. ......Показать, что даже с этим чудом ты не смогла бы избежать трагедии!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Eu realmente tive que dar duro para encontrar Lion. Bem como Beato sonhou, a existência de Lion é um verdadeiro milagre. E, ao fim de seu funeral, eu queria mostrar isso a você. .........Que mesmo {i:com} esse milagre, você não pode escapar da tragédia!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………要找到理御，真是辛苦死我了。畢竟，這一存在，就跟貝阿朵夢想中的一樣，真的是個奇跡。然後，我想在葬禮的最後給她瞧瞧這個。………給她瞧瞧，即便有了這個奇跡，你還是逃不過慘劇！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………要找到理御，真是辛苦死我了。毕竟，这一存在，就跟贝阿朵梦想中的一样，真的是个奇迹。然后，我想在葬礼的最后给她瞧瞧这个。………给她瞧瞧，即便有了这个奇迹，你还是逃不过惨剧！！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "... Ho dovuto lavorare duramente per trovare Lion. Come Beato sognava, la sua esistenza è un vero miracolo. E, alla fine del tuo funerale, volevo mostrarti ciò. ... Mostrarti che, persino con quel miracolo, non avresti evitato questa tragedia!!"

Steam (ST): Through the small crack between the bars of the jail that imprisoned her, the witch called {f:5:Beatrice} dreamed of a world where she might have been happy...
Umineko Project (UP): Faced with the little bit of sky that she could see through the bars of the jail that imprisoned her, the witch called {f:5:Beatrice} dreamed of a world where she might have been happy...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Through the small crack between the bars of the jail that imprisoned her, the witch called Beatrice dreamed of a world where she might have been happy...
PC Japanese (JP): 決して出られぬ牢獄の鉄格子の先に見えるわずかな空に、ベアトリーチェという魔女は、幸せになれたかもしれない世界を夢想した…。
Russian (RU): Через крошечную щель в решётке своей тюрьмы ведьма {f:5:Беатриче} мечтала о мире, где могла бы быть счастлива...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Diante do pedacinho de céu que ela podia ver através das barras da prisão que a aprisionava, a bruxa chamada {f:5:Beatrice} sonhou com um mundo onde até mesmo ela podia ser feliz...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 面對能從絕對出不去的監牢鐵窗前方看到的一點點天空，貝阿朵莉切這個魔女，夢想了自己有可能得到幸福的世界…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 面对能从绝对出不去的监牢铁窗前方看到的一点点天空，贝阿朵莉切这个魔女，梦想了自己有可能得到幸福的世界…。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Nonostante la piccola fessura tra le sbarre della gabbia che la imprigionava, la strega chiamata Beatrice sognava un mondo dove potesse essere felice...

Steam (ST): However, the space she could see through that crack in the bars... was just another part of the same jail...
Umineko Project (UP): However, the sky beyond the bars............was also part of a larger jail......
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, the space she could see through that crack in the bars... was just another part of the same jail......
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、その鉄格子の先の空は、…………またしても、牢獄の中だったのだ……。
Russian (RU): Однако пространство, которое она видела через щель в решётке...... было всего лишь продолжением той же тюрьмы......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porém, o céu além das barras............também era parte de uma grande prisão......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然而，這個鐵窗前方的天空，…………卻依舊仍在監牢之中……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然而，这个铁窗前方的天空，…………却依旧仍在监牢之中……。
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): Tuttavia, lo spazio che poteva vedere attraverso quella fessura nelle sbarre... era solo un'altra parte della stessa prigione...

Speaker: Ushiromiya Lion
Steam (ST): "The more I hear, ...the less I understand about you...! Why...would you do something like this...?!"
Umineko Project (UP): "The more I hear......the less I understand about you......! Why......would you do something like this...?!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "The more I hear......the less I understand about you......! Why...would you do something like this...?!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「私には、………あなたという人が、ますますにわからない……！あなたは、……なぜこんなことをするのですか…！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「私には、………あなたという人が、ますますにわからない……！　あなたは、……なぜこんなことをするのですか…！」
Russian (RU): "Чем больше я слышу...... тем меньше понимаю вас!.. Зачем вам...... делать нечто подобное?!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Quanto mais eu ouço......menos entendo sobre você......! Por que......iria querer algo assim...?!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我、………越來越搞不懂你這個人了……！你、……為什麼要做這種事…？！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我、………越来越搞不懂你这个人了……！你、……为什么要做这种事…？！」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Più ti ascolto... e meno ti capisco...! Perché... fai una cosa del genere...?!"

Speaker: {f:5:Bernkastel}
Steam (ST): "I lost a game to {f:5:Beatrice}, so I wanted to get back at her. ...*giggle*giggle*!! Yeah, now I feel a lot better about losing that game...! Hey, Beato, are you watching? Can you see this?! And do you remember? Remember when I promised you that a miracle wouldn't occur, with certainty?!"
Umineko Project (UP): "I lost a game to Beato, so I wanted to get back at her. ......*giggle*giggle*!! Yeah, now I feel a lot better about losing that game...! Hey, Beato, are you watching? Can you see this?! And do you remember? Remember when I promised you that there would be absolutely no miracles?!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I lost a game to Beatrice, so I wanted to get back at her. ......*giggle*giggle*!! Yeah, now I feel a lot better about losing that game...! Hey, Beato, are you watching? Can you see this?! And do you remember? Remember when I promised you that a miracle wouldn't occur, with certainty?!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「ベアトにゲームで負けたから、腹いせで。……くすくすくすくす！！　あぁ、これで少しは負けたムカツキも晴れてきたわ…！　ねぇ、ベアト、見てる？　見えてる？！　そして覚えてる？！　あなたには、絶対に奇跡は起きないって、私、約束したわよね？！」
Russian (RU): "Я проиграла Беато игру и хотела отомстить ей. ......*хи‐хи*хи‐хи*! Да, теперь мне гораздо лучше!.. Эй, Беато, ты наблюдаешь? Ты видишь?! И помнишь? Помнишь, как я пообещала тебе, что чуда ни за что не будет?!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu perdi um jogo para a Beato, por isso quero retalhá‐la. ......*risos*risos*!! Sim, agora eu me sinto muito melhor por ter perdido aquele jogo...! Ei, Beato, está assistindo isso? Consegue me ver?! Você se lembra? Lembra quando eu prometi que não haveria absolutamente nenhum milagre?!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「因為在遊戲裡被貝阿朵打敗了，所以我要泄憤。……呵呵呵呵！！啊啊，這下當初戰敗的積怨，是稍有點舒解了呢…！喂，貝阿朵，看到了沒？看到了沒？！還有，你還記得不？！我曾擔保過，你絕對不會有奇跡吧？！」

Speaker: {f:5:Bernkastel}
Steam (ST): "You've shown that Beato's fantasy is a mystery and cut it to pieces. You've fulfilled your role. I would've let you be, if only you'd just left quietly. Now that you've strolled back in here, you can hardly complain if I make you my plaything."
Umineko Project (UP): "You've shown that Beato's fantasy is a mystery and cut it to pieces. You've fulfilled your role. I would've let you be, if only you'd just left quietly. Now that you've strolled on back here, you can hardly complain when I make you my plaything, can you?"

PC Japanese (JP): 「ベアトのファンタジーをミステリーだと断言してぶった切ってくれた。あんたの役目はそれでおしまい。大人しく帰っていれば、それで見逃してやったのに。のこのこと戻ってきたからには、私の玩具にされても文句は言えないわね？」
Russian (RU): "Ты показал, что фантастика Беато — детектив, и разрезал её на кусочки. Твоя роль выполнена. Я бы оставила тебя в покое, если бы ты молча ушёл. Но раз уж тебя занесло обратно, вряд ли тебе будет на что жаловаться, когда я сделаю тебя своей игрушкой."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Você demonstrou que a fantasia da Beato era um mistério e a partiu em pedaços. Já cumpriu com seu papel. Eu pretendia deixá‐lo ir, apenas se partisse em silêncio. Agora que voltou para passear por aqui, não pode mais reclamar quando eu fizer de você meu brinquedo, sabia?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「你幫我把貝阿朵的幻想劇斷言成了推理劇，將之砍翻。你的任務已到此結束。明明只要老老實實地回去，我就放你一馬了。既然滿不在乎地回來了，那就怪不得我把你變成我的玩具了哦？」

Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Hai mostrato che il fantasy di Beato è un mystery e l'hai fatto a pezzi. Hai svolto il tuo ruolo. Ti avrei lasciato stare, se solo te ne fossi andato tranquillamente. Ora che sei tornato qui, non ti puoi lamentare se faccio diventare anche te un mio giocattolo."

Speaker: Willard H. Wright
Steam (ST): "Kyrie and Rudolf are the culprits, and they massacred the people on the island? They called Lion out to the parlor, then shot Lion to death? Sorry, but I can't acknowledge this "truth" of yours as a mystery. This is all fantasy."
Umineko Project (UP): "Kyrie and Rudolf are the culprits, and they massacred the people on the island? They called Lion out to the parlor, then shot Lion to death? Sorry, but the concept of mysteries rejects this "truth" of yours. This is all fantasy."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Kyrie and Rudolf are the culprits, and they massacred the people on the island? They called Lion out to the parlor, then shot Lion to death? Sorry, but this 'truth' of yours just doesn't work as a mystery. This is all fantasy."
PC Japanese (JP): 「霧江と留弗夫が犯人で、島の人間を皆殺しにした？　理御を客間に呼び出して射殺した？悪ぃな、そんな“真実”とやらを、ミステリーが認めるわけには行かねェ。こいつは全て、ファンタジーだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「霧江と留弗夫が犯人で、島の人間を皆殺しにした？　理御を客間に呼び出して射殺した？　悪ぃな、そんな“真実”とやらを、ミステリーが認めるわけには行かねェ。こいつは全て、ファンタジーだ」
Russian (RU): "Преступники — Кирие и Рудольф, и это они убили людей на острове? Лион приходит по их просьбе в гостиную, а затем умирает от их пули? Извини, но твоя 'правда' не может быть признана детективом. Всё это фантастика."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Kyrie e Rudolf são os culpados e massacraram todas as pessoas na ilha? Então chamaram Lion para a sala de visitas e mataram Lion com um tiro? Foi mal, mas o conceito dos mistérios rejeita essa sua "verdade". Isso é tudo fantasia."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「霧江與留弗夫是凶手，把這島上的人全殺光了？把理御叫到客廳，將其槍殺？不好意思，我不能把這種“真實”承認為推理劇。這些全部都是幻想劇。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「雾江与留弗夫是凶手，把这岛上的人全杀光了？把理御叫到客厅，将其枪杀？不好意思，我不能把这种“真实”承认为推理剧。这些全部都是幻想剧。」
Italian (Ars Magica) (Old) (ITA): "Kyrie e Rudolf sono i colpevoli, e hanno massacrato le persone sull'isola? Hanno chiamato Lion nel salotto, e poi hanno sparato mortalmente Lion? {n}Scusa, ma questa tua ‘verità’ non funziona come mystery. Questo è tutto fantasy."

Speaker: Willard H. Wright

Speaker: Willard H. Wright
Steam (ST): Of course not. What a person's life means, what it's worth, what it is...these are things each person decides for themselves. ...No matter what sort of fate is forced upon them. Don't accept it. Create your own world...for yourself...!"
Umineko Project (UP): "Of course not. What a person's life means, what it's worth, what it is—these are things a person decides for themselves. ......So what if a fate's been forced upon you? Don't accept it. Create your own world...for yourself...!"

Speaker: {f:5:Bernkastel}
Steam (ST): "Come, my kitties. I won't order you to kill them. Just clean up the two pieces whose role has ended."
